content.raw:
Well I am not enough of a ros expert to know how to make a rosbag. But I can say that the torso lean is publishing on the PelvisOrientationTrajectory topic. 

We build a quaternion_about_axis around the -Z axis to lean the R5 forward (often about -15 degrees, sometimes -20 depending on the task) once this happens with this setup the R5's body starts so oscillate  with growing speed until the pelvis is returned to upright.
content.html:
Well I am not enough of a ros expert to know how to make a rosbag. But I can say that the torso lean is publishing on the PelvisOrientationTrajectory topic.

We build a quaternion_about_axis around the -Z axis to lean the R5 forward (often about -15 degrees, sometimes -20 depending on the task) once this happens with this setup the R5's body starts so oscillate with growing speed until the pelvis is returned to upright.
